info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 08 at 10:02PM CST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT WESTERN JASPER...SOUTHEASTERN RANKIN...EASTERN SIMPSON...SMITH...NORTHERN COVINGTON...NORTHWESTERN JONES AND NORTHWESTERN JEFFERSON DAVIS COUNTIES THROUGH 1100 PM CST... At 1002 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Johns to near New Hebron. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Magee, Polkville, Puckett, Sanatorium, Clem, White Oak, and Martinville around 1005 PM CST. Mount Olive and Burns around 1015 PM CST. Raleigh and Mize around 1020 PM CST. Center Ridge and Pineville around 1025 PM CST. Taylorsville and Sylvarena around 1030 PM CST. Bay Springs, Louin, Montrose, and Hebron around 1035 PM CST. Soso, Turnerville, and Stringer around 1040 PM CST. Garlandville around 1045 PM CST. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 AM CST for south central and southeastern Mississippi.
